descriptions.overview: This expandable dining table is where practicality meets functionality. In its starting position, this table is a generous 61 In. long and 37 In. wide, offering great space for up to 4 people. By unlocking each end, sliding the two leaves of the top apart and flipping the hinged top, it easily becomes a 83 In. long table, giving you ample room for 6 people or more. This table is built of heavy duty steel and rust-resistant aluminum and is finished with a matte black powder-coat, ensuring durability and dependability.
list: Sturdy, durable and rust-resistant steel and aluminum dining table
Table expands to over 83 inches long, with ample seating for 6 or more people
Matte black powder-coating resists the elements and works with almost any style

reviews.title: "Great Great Table!!!"
reviews.text: This table is wonderful! The way to expand it is nice and stylish, see the video demostration. Very good looking for the look, very strong for the use, very heavy for the strong wind resistance.  The installation was easy with myself alone and I am not even a handyman, I am a very lazy man. The only hard part was no one was there to help me flip the table, I had to be careful not to scratch the table top while flip it alone.  So if it is easy for me as a lazy man, it should be super easy for you guys out there as the handyman.
reviews.author: udeupa

reviews.title: "Solid Table for our Deck"
reviews.text: Had our deck rebuilt and wanted to have a place to enjoy meals outside. This table is solid and we enjoy the ability for it to expand. It fits well on the deck with some existing chairs we have and we have used it a lot. The benefit is that when expanding, the base does NOT move and the table expands through a railing system to reveal the 'hidden' section. Anyway, it's a cool table and I hope it lasts 4-5 years. I will most likely bring it inside during the coldest but that's only a couple of months out of the year.
reviews.author: Steph

reviews.title: "TBD"
reviews.text: LOVE the look of the table and its ability to extend, as well as its price.  We just purchased it a couple of weeks ago so it is hard to recommend.  My first concern was that it would get very hot being metal and black, but it just gets warm to the touch.  The second concern is that it will rust.  We had a ton of rain recently and when I moved the table afterwards there was a puddle of rusty water beneath it.  So this concern may be valid given that it has only been in the elements for a couple of weeks.  It also scratches very easily so need to use placemats etc to protect.
reviews.author: NJ

reviews.title: "We love this table!"
reviews.text: After looking for a Patio table that had a built-in butterfly extension, we found this one at Lowe's.  We live in Arizona where it's not practical to have wooden tables/chairs as they split from the dryness/heat of the air and would require too much Care.   We found this metal version and are thrilled with how great it looks on our Deck.   Very simple assembly of legs (only) and we were all set to enjoy it within 10 mins..  Definitely recommend the quality, construction, and practicality of function and design!   And certainly can't beat it for the price ($168)!!
reviews.author: TucsonDeco

reviews.title: "bad manufacturing"
reviews.text: the table is not bad, but overall quality should be better, one of the rivets under the table was not properly attached. it hits the leg, I can't slide until the end to be able to flip extension. Most likely it will be easier to replace the revit rather than returning to get a new table. I have not contacted the manufacturer yet.For this price, expected better quality.
reviews.author: M

reviews.title: "Solid outfoor Table for 4-6 people"
reviews.text: I'm surprised to find such a well made table for this price. Super easy to assemble as it only for legs that fit into slots and then bolted with 2 bolts each leg. The wrench was included.  One person could and did do it all. I like the neat way the table expands to the larger size from an extra leaf inside the table. Packaging was very good. No damage or scratches at all. All the legs, bolts, washers and the wrench are shrink-wrapped and can't get lost in the shipping process. Very well thought out.
reviews.author: Pathfinder

reviews.title: "NOT Rust Resistant."
reviews.text: Rust all over my deck and underside of middle section.   Obviously, not all areas treated with rust protectant.
reviews.author: PaulW

reviews.title: "Great Table"
reviews.text: Saw this table and loved the extension option. A few reviewers commented on RUST but if you read the description, it's rust "resistant" not rust "free".  After reading the reviews I decided buy it. Since the table was so affordable, I bought a can of Rustoleum and spray painted for an extra level of protection.  Haven't had a single problem!
reviews.author: Jkat

reviews.title: "Awesome table!"
reviews.text: Installation and quality of parts: It's solidly built and easily put together. I couldn't find the instructions (turns out they were inside the table on the "leaf") but honestly...the parts are so simple that the instructions weren't necessary. It's 8 bolts, washers and lock washers...two for each leg. It even comes with a wrench but I used a 13 mm socket to make it go faster as I was short on time before needing to actually use the table.The table itself is sturdy and has adjustable plastic levelers on the bottom of the legs so you can make it level as needed. This is going to make an awesome addition to my furniture. I do recommend finding a table cloth to use as any messes (such as drinks that get bumped) will not be contained going through the slats, haha. Learned that lesson from experience but I'll give you that lesson learned free of charge. :D
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Not the highest quality but perfectly functional"
reviews.text: The table isnt made of the sturdiest materials but its perfect for our smaller deck.  It was easy to put together and the expansion part is great.  One thing that is annoying is that you have to lock and unlock it underneath and it doesnt just slide into place when you expand it.  If it clicked into place, it would be better.  If you purchase this, check the table before putting it together.  Mine had a huge gash in the table
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "rusty table"
reviews.text: I had to return this table to Lowes because, after a week, rust was running down the legs and staining my patio. We didn't get a chance to use the table and the chairs weren't unwrapped yet, so everything went back.  My Lowes store was very good about taking the furniture back but I'm very disappointed in  the product.
reviews.author: unhappyinpa

reviews.title: "No luck"
reviews.text: I purchased this table to only it home to see all the latches to lock extension busted and in box. I went to Lowe's to exchange to have the same issue. Since this was the last in stock I asked for display, which also had the latches bused off. Not sure if anyone else has encountered this. Ended up purchasing a diff model in the end and happy.
reviews.author: Shaun

reviews.title: "Not functional for an expandable Table"
reviews.text: I love the look of this table.  Modern and not a glass top.  Was so excited to find it for the price, because it was to go on the screen porch and I have limited space.  Assembly was easy, but missing a couple of washers.  I paired with the wicker chairs from Loews and the look was perfect.  Packaging great, quality decent, function not so good.  The Table seats 6 easily at 61", but one would expect to set 8 when the table is expanded to the 80+ inches, not so.  The base does not expand, the table only overhangs the base by about 10 inches and you can not fit another chair along the side.  I will return this table.
reviews.author: Allison

reviews.title: "Like the table but had huge dent in the table top"
reviews.text: Table is great it is what we wanted and seems to be pretty sturdy. However before you take this hope take the time to open the box and inspect it. Ours had a huge dent in the top. Am taking it back to Lowe's today to try and get another one.
reviews.author: treknight

reviews.title: "Great table"
reviews.text: I absolutely love this table. It's very sturdy, easy to put together. Love the extra leave and how it hides away when not in use. Worth the price and more.
reviews.author: Kmac

reviews.title: "Great product."
reviews.text: Easy to assemble, well built and looks great on my deck.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Great table"
reviews.text: Love this extendable table. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because it didn't include split lock washers in parts pack as noted in directions. Phone number on instructions and in-store were not knowledgeable about product or parts. My local ACE hardware had the parts and advice for 40 cents. Was quick and easy to put together after I got the parts.
reviews.author: Russelk

reviews.title: "Extension table! Great idea!"
reviews.text: We bought this to replace an old table that was shot. Before we bought it we read the reviews. Was concerned about the 'rust' issue. Since I intended to paint it green to match the other furniture I figure that a few coats of Krylon should solve the problem. Looking the table over I can see how water could puddle in the flip over center leaf when it is stored, but those panels are aluminum so I don't think that will be an issue for us. I like that, with the legs on the corners, that we can scooch the chairs all the way under it to save space. Someone else complained that it was too high, but it measures 29" from the floor which is only 1" higher than the old table. Perhaps the guy didn't have the cushions on his chairs. LOL. I will post an update this fall after I see how the rust thing works out. Very happy with it so far.
reviews.author: Harry

reviews.title: "Rusty Treasures"
reviews.text: Started dripping rusty water after a couple rain storms. Many different areas, not just one. Glad I got the lemon apparently.
reviews.author: Jon

reviews.title: "Rusted"
reviews.text: Supposed to be rust free. But it rusted after 2 months.
reviews.author: Amanda

reviews.title: "rusty table"
reviews.text: I had to return this table to Lowes because, after a week, rust was running down the legs and staining my patio. We didn't get a chance to use the table and the chairs weren't unwrapped yet, so everything went back.  My Lowes store was very good about taking the furniture back but I'm very disappointed in  the product.
reviews.author: unhappyinpa

reviews.title: "No luck"
reviews.text: I purchased this table to only it home to see all the latches to lock extension busted and in box. I went to Lowe's to exchange to have the same issue. Since this was the last in stock I asked for display, which also had the latches bused off. Not sure if anyone else has encountered this. Ended up purchasing a diff model in the end and happy.

Assembly was easy, but missing a couple of washers.  I paired with the wicker chairs from Loews and the look was perfect.  Packaging great, quality decent, function not so good.  The Table seats 6 easily at 61", but one would expect to set 8 when the table is expanded to the 80+ inches, not so. reviews.author: Jon

reviews.title: "Rusted"
reviews.text: Supposed to be rust free. But it rusted after 2 months.
reviews.author: Amanda

reviews.title: "Beware - Lousy Paint Job!"
reviews.text: I like the table a lot - but 2 days in, paint started to peel and flake off. I was able to touch it up with black spray paint, but what a hassle
reviews.author: leem

reviews.title: "Quality table. Easily assembled."
reviews.text: Feet can be adjusted in height to compensate for slight inclines. Butterfly insert is great for ease and durability. Make sure to flip/empty any collected water or soap after rain or cleaning.
reviews.author: JT

reviews.title: "Expandability is a great feature"
reviews.text: A well built substantial table. It is easy to expand and the self storing expansion piece works well. The downside is that this table is higher than most others to compensate for the on-board leaf. We have to buy new chairs as our existing chairs are not high enough. The black powder finish does chip and scratch fairly easily and might gave been more durable with a faux wood grain finish. We will cover with a table cloth or placemats to protect the top. All in all, a good choice if one needs the option for expansion.
reviews.author: jfe18

reviews.title: "Easy to assemble"
reviews.text: The table was very easy to assemble and I like that the extension piece is built right into the table.
reviews.author: SutFam

reviews.title: "Nice but missing the umbrella hole"
reviews.text: Really like the table and the cool extension but that prevents it from having a spot for an umbrella.
reviews.author: Missy

reviews.text: Great patio set, very comfortable and little to assemble. Price was very reasonable.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Great Expandable table"
reviews.text: Bought this for my new sun room addition! Perfect fit, looks great. Family loves it thanks to the expandable leaf that flops up in the middle when you pull the ends out....gives you another 30 inches, everyone fits around the table. Easy to put together, very durable, easy to wipe clean after use. Looks great when not in use! Great value for the money....10 thumps up!!!
reviews.author: Wes

reviews.title: "Perfectly modern!"
reviews.text: Love our new Pelham Bay Extendable patio table! Perfect for our everyday family of 4 and extends for when we have additional guests. It was easy to assemble and cleans up nicely. I love the black finish and clean lines which compliment perfectly with our modern style. The table extends with ease and locks into place to secure in just a few simple snaps.
reviews.author: JenniC

reviews.title: "Versatile and Great Value"
reviews.text: After searching at about 6 other stores for a patio table on a budget we couldn't resist this one. It fit our needs perfectly and we love the versatility of adding an additional 2 seats worth of space for larger gatherings. That, combined with the contractor pack of 8 garden treasures wicker chairs we now have a great setup for a great price
reviews.author: BujoGal

reviews.title: "Bad Table"
reviews.text: Purchased this table on February 2018 and is now July 2018 and is rusting and scratched on top.  For a table that is meant for outside is not the greatest and very bad quality.  I have wasted my money on this and will not recommend to anyone to buy it.
reviews.author: magicalwizard

reviews.title: "Value and flexibility"
reviews.text: This table is a great value and offers easy flexibility to expand dining capacity when extra guests arrive. I would recommend a cover: it is metal and does heat up in the sun, so need some shade. Unsure how prone to rust- suppose well find out soon. But for the price point, not much comparable. Plus it looks pretty good too.
reviews.author: Dude1

reviews.title: "Length versus Width"
reviews.text: So not to be too picky, but I believe this table is 37 inches WIDE and 61 inches LONG expanding to 83 inches LONG.  The description might confuse; some might say, "what does it matter, length/width;" but there are certain conventions of descriptions, right?  Really like the table and how it expands.  Wonderful engineering.
reviews.author: nkj

reviews.title: "Great table"
reviews.text: I have been looking for an outside table that I could leave out. I didn't want a glass top. This table is well built and it looks very stylish. I love that it expands and it is sturdy. It was easy to put together. I am glad I happened to walk by it on my way to buy mulch at Lowe's. It called my name! I bought it!
reviews.author: Love

reviews.title: "Nice, but scratched up"
reviews.text: We really like our new patio table. I love that it extends and it is easy to clean. The only downside is that when it arrived, it had all those scratches on the side. Nothing too major, but it just makes it look like we have had it a couple years instead of being brand new. Other than that it is a great table
reviews.author: Emily

reviews.title: "Great Choice - Very Versatile"
reviews.text: Love this table. Weather resistant for totally exposed outside use. Easily seats 4 to 6 for meals in the standard configuration. But then easily accommodates 4 additional drop ins when extended. The leveling feet on the legs made it simple to level the table on our slightly sloped concrete deck.
reviews.author: JohnM

reviews.title: "We Love this Table"
reviews.text: We were shopping for patio furniture and fell in love with this table. The versatility of this table allows us extra seating places as needed for when we have additional people over. The table is sturdy and has so far lived up to our expectations.
reviews.author: Alex

reviews.title: "So far, so good!"
reviews.text: This table looks great! It was easily assembled and extends easily. We haven't put it outside in the elements yet, so time will tell if it holds up well once we do.  So far, we're very happy with it.
reviews.author: Beth

reviews.text: There was a dent in the flip leaf but the company took care of it immediately.  Well constructed, easy minor assembly, no bar to hit knees on and very sturdy. It looks great on our porch.
reviews.author: FrankLyn

reviews.title: "Nice Table, Easy to Assemble"
reviews.text: This is perfect for outdoor dining with a larger group. We love that you can expand the table to accommodate more people. It was super quick and easy to assemble too!
reviews.author: Rachel

reviews.title: "Modern Matte Black Outdoor Table"
reviews.text: We are very happy with this purchase! The table was easy to assemble (just screw in the legs) and looks great on our patio. We love that it is easily extendable too!
reviews.author: K-Knox

reviews.title: "A friend had purchased this table & I loved it."
reviews.text: Love this table. Can be small for 2 or 4 diners, but expands very easily for 6 or 8. Great design on the fold down table extension.  Very sturdy & stable.
reviews.author: Magoo

reviews.title: "Excellent purchase"
reviews.text: This table is of high quality with a reasonable price tag. It has a built in leaf which enables you to sit 8 comfortably.  Very happy with our purchase
reviews.author: Margi

reviews.title: "Perfect table"
reviews.text: It is a sturdy and fairly heavy table.   Super easy to put together.  When expanded it seats at least 8.   I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
reviews.author: Mc

reviews.title: "Awesome table"
reviews.text: Table is very sturdy, well built, good price and the fact that it opens to a longer table by just opening and flipping up the extension is awesome!
reviews.author: Jo

reviews.text: I and my husband love our table. It is beautiful I, our out door,patioI would tell every one about it.  It expands to a larger size.
reviews.author: Sarah

reviews.title: "Table with water spots"
reviews.text: Realized after it has rained a few times now that since I didn't wipe table off or dry it the water spots don't go away?
reviews.author: LRadli

reviews.title: "Great outdoor table"
reviews.text: The table was easy to assemble, is sturdy for being outside and the expandable feature is very nice. We really like it!
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Awesome deck table"
reviews.text: This is a perfect table as you can leave it a normal for everyday use or extend it for family gatherings or company.
reviews.author: Jn819

reviews.title: "Great table"
reviews.text: Looks great! Very sturdy. Easy to put together. Put a tarp over it when it rained last week and no issues with rust.
reviews.author: Al

reviews.title: "Love!!"
reviews.text: We love this table. I love the fact that I can make it larger with just a flip. Perfect for my backyard gatherings.
reviews.author: Msrwolfe03

reviews.title: "Great Table"
reviews.text: The table is sturdy and was very easy to put together.  The extension is easy to do and it perfect for our deck.
reviews.author: Pineapplegal

reviews.title: "Excellent table for entertaining"
reviews.text: This table was easy to assemble and looks great on our deck.  It easily expands from seating 8 to seating 12.
reviews.author: Daniel

reviews.title: "Perfect Table!"
reviews.text: Love this table and it's perfect for our deck.  The "hidden" leaf will come in handy for bigger gatherings!
reviews.author: Andrea

reviews.title: "Great table!!!"
reviews.text: Very sturdy table and I love the fact that it has the leaf in the table. Great Table!!
reviews.author: Cheri

reviews.title: "New outdoor table"
reviews.text: Wasn't shopping for a new table, but couldn't resist. Folds to make smaller, love it
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "Love this table!!"
reviews.text: This table is great! Easy to clean and the expansion is wonderful! Kid friendly :)
reviews.author: Samantha

reviews.title: "Outdoor expansion dining"
reviews.text: 4-10 for BBQ ? No problem. Slide out the extension and get the party started !
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "Outstanding  patio table."
reviews.text: Good size. Lowe's had a great selection. Table fits perfectly on our patio.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Great table in store...I haven't opened mine yet"
reviews.text: I loved this table in store.  When I open mine I am sure I will love it
reviews.author: Bevblanton

reviews.title: "Versatile and attractive"
reviews.text: Well-made and easily expandable makes for a great outdoor dining table.
reviews.author: Vito

reviews.title: "Love table"
reviews.text: So glad I have a table that I can make larger, if I need more space.
reviews.author: MaryAnn

reviews.title: "Pelham Bay table"
reviews.text: Exactly what we were looking for! Extremely easy to put together.
reviews.author: Mommy9236

reviews.title: "Patio table"
reviews.text: Was to assemble, looks great in the patio. Can't wait to use it!
reviews.author: Bev

reviews.title: "Extendable table"
reviews.text: Awesome table with hidden extendable leaf. Sits 6 people easily
reviews.author: Trish

reviews.title: "Nice large famly friendly patio table"
reviews.text: Love this table. This will accommodate our large family.
reviews.author: Bernita

reviews.title: "Great table"
reviews.text: Love that it expands to a size we need for eight guests.
reviews.author: Jus

reviews.text: Great size both for small parties and large affairs
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.title: "Happy with our purchase!"
reviews.text: Easy to construct, convenient to change the length!
reviews.author: AMy

reviews.text: Easy to put together great product easy to extend!
reviews.author: Ms

questions.question: "Is there a umbrella hole in the table"
questions.author: Feather

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: No, this table does not include and umbrella hole.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this table does not have an umbrella hole.

answers.author: Davide
answers.text: No there is not, as the middle contains a built in leaf for adjustable length.

answers.author: Davide
answers.text: No there is not

questions.question: "its says it's rust resistant - is it really? why are folks with the 1 star saying it's leaving rust puddles. Should it really not be used outside?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Jon
answers.text: Ours started dripping rusty water after a couple rains.

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: The product is rust-resistant but not rust-proof. When not in use, the manufacturer suggests using protective patio furniture covers to prolong the life of your table.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this table is rust-resistant. There is no information available for your remaining questions.

questions.question: "Is the table black or brown. The description says black but the table looks brown in the pictures."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: The table is brown.

answers.author: Tom
answers.text: We just purchased this table and when we took it out of the box it is virtually black not brown.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, the table is brown.

questions.question: "When it is extended and you sit 3 people on each side, don't 4 of them have to sit w/ a table leg between their legs?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Bev
answers.text: I have this table, it's nice that it extends, but because of the poor design on where the table legs are, the 4 people sitting at the ends will have the table leg in the way.

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: This table sits 2 chairs on each side and 1 chair on each end, even when extended.

questions.question: "How many does this seat when extended? Could it swat 8?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: SierraFoxtrot
answers.text: I looked at this table in the store and although it extends to provide enough room for 8 (3 on each side and 1 on each end), the placement of the table legs makes it awkward for this arrangement. A leg would be centered right in front of 4 of the people. We decided not to buy the table for this reason... what is the point of extending it?

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: The Pelham Bay Rectangle Extendable Dining Table has seating for 6 or more people.

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: The Garden Treasures Pelham Bay Rectangle Extendable Table weighs 87.59lbs without the packaging.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, it is over 100 lbs. It is 113.5 lbs.

questions.question: "Hello - one of the locks underneath our table is broken. Can you please provide details on how we get a new one?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: We apologize for the inconvenience. Please contact us directly at 800-643-0067 so that we may gather more information and assist.

answers.author: cbmjeep
answers.text: I called the number on the literature and they sent me a whole new top! Now I have a heavy top that I took the latch off of and no legs.

questions.question: "I could not find this in the description. What is the length with and without it extended? Thanks!"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: This table is 61" long and 83" once extended.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The table width is 37. 4 inches. The other information you requested is not currently available.

questions.question: "Does the leaf lock or can an unbalanced load cause it to flip down?"
questions.author: Jaybird

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: This table does lock.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, the leaf does lock in place.

questions.question: "Is there a umbrella hole in the table"
questions.author: Feather

answers.author: Product Manufacturer
answers.text: This table does not include and umbrella hole.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this table does not have an umbrella hole.
